intro: Astrophytum asterias, commonly known as the star cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to the deserts of Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stem covered in prominent radial spines and white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its fleshy stem to survive drought conditions. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for succulent gardens. The flowers are typically tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and bats.
